urls.title: Coronavirus: EA extends relaxed rules on monitoring and reporting
urls.description: The Environment Agency (EA) has extended three regulatory position statements (RPS), which are aimed at relaxing the requirements on firms who cannot comply with their permits due to Covid-19.

Be alert but not alarmed. Don't panic, but be prepared:
-Check your risk and know what to do if you need to take action https://t.co/iGhhOQOhh8
-Sign up to free #FloodWarnings
-Keep away from swollen rivers & don't drive through flood water

#StormChristoph #PrepareAct @EnvAgency

To help protect yourself and loved ones from harm, and homes and businesses from damage, it's vital that you please check your risk and sign-up to free @EnvAgency #FloodWarnings now: https://t.co/iGhhOQOhh8

#PrepareActSurvive #StormChristoph

text: Flow monitoring has just been installed on two of the rain planters @CarshaltonHigh. urls.description: I’ve spent the past few days highlighting the years of neglect and environmental horror show at my local wetlands, Brent Reservoir (Welsh Harp) in NW London. Through underfunding this famous location...

text: @BarnetCouncil @Brent_Council @EnvAgency @CanalRiverTrust @NaturalEngland why has this been allowed to happen? Why not get together & sort this mess out? It’s a #SSSI that’s in dire need of help! #brentreservoir #welshharp https://t.co/SxHzUQJ69U

Good to see @theodoraclarke and The PM #PMQs discussing ‘my’ flood on Sandon Road #Stafford. Floods are now weekly. It’s not just high water level. Drains need unblocking, trees opposite ATS lopped, leaf fall and mud cleared promptly @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/yQC9EZfGel
